title: Nifty Top Gainers Today: Dr Reddys Labs, Cipla, L&T stocks lead on Nifty 50 index
content: At 11:30 am on Thursday, Dr Reddys Labs stock was among the top gainers on the Nifty 50. Dr Reddys Labs was trading at Rs 1,266.20, a 1.67% increase from its previous close. Cipla, Larsen, Reliance and Bharat Electronics shares were other top gainers on Nifty 50.Dr. Reddy's Labs Financial OverviewDr. Reddy's Labs' financial performance reveals key insights into its revenue, profitability, and overall financial health. title: Catalyst Trusteeship Invokes Equity Shares of Sadhana Nitrochem
content: Catalyst Trusteeship Ltd, in its capacity as Security Trustee, has invoked equity shares of Sadhana Nitrochem Ltd, citing regulatory compliance under SEBI's Substantial Acquisition of Shares and Takeovers Regulations, 2011. The disclosure relates to the sale of these invoked shares in favor of Catalyst Trusteeship Ltd. As of August 20, 2025, Catalyst Trusteeship Ltd held 1,98,59,167 shares of Sadhana Nitrochem Ltd, representing 6.02% of both the total and diluted share/voting capital. This percentage remained unchanged post-acquisition. Shareholding DetailsParticularsNumber of Shares% w.r.t Total Share/Voting Capital% w.r.t Total Diluted Share/Voting CapitalBefore Acquisition1,98,59,1676.026.02After Acquisition1,98,59,1676.026.02 Sadhana Nitrochem Ltd's equity share capital/total voting capital before and after the sale stood at 32,94,11,057 paid-up equity shares of INR 1 each. The transaction occurred on August 20, 2025. Alpesh Patil, Manager at Catalyst Trusteeship Ltd, is the authorized signatory for this disclosure. The sale of invoked equity shares was executed on August 20, 2025.
summary_lexrank: The disclosure relates to the sale of these invoked shares in favor of Catalyst Trusteeship Ltd. As of August 20, 2025, Catalyst Trusteeship Ltd held 1,98,59,167 shares of Sadhana Nitrochem Ltd, representing 6.02% of both the total and diluted share/voting capital.

title: Ola Electric shares fall 7.44%, among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150 in today's trading
content: Ola Electric's stock experienced a significant downturn, falling 7.44% to Rs 49.25 in Thursday's trading session. This places it among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150. At 11:30 am, other notable declines on the Nifty Midcap 150 included 360 ONE WAM, Berger Paints, United Breweries, and J. K. Cement. 360 ONE WAM shares also faced downward pressure, declining 1.89% to Rs 1,082.10. Berger Paints saw a decrease of 1.59%, trading at Rs 534.85, while United Breweries' shares fell 1.5% to Rs 1,896.60. J. K. Cement experienced a drop of 1.37%, with shares priced at Rs 7,435.50. title: Coal India shares fall 1.31%; stock among top losers on Nifty 50 in today's trading
content: Shares of Coal India were among the top losers on the Nifty 50, trading at Rs 379.65, a 1.31% decline in Thursday's session. TATA Cons. Prod, HUL, Power Grid Corp, and Nestle were also among the top losers on the Nifty 50. Coal India is included as one of the stocks in the benchmark NIFTY 50 index. The yearly consolidated financial data reveals consistent growth in revenue and net profit. Revenue has increased steadily from Rs 90,026.01 Crore in 2021 to Rs 143,368.92 Crore in 2025. Net profit has also shown a substantial increase from Rs 12,705.14 Crore in 2021 to Rs 34,839.84 Crore in 2025. However, there is a slight decrease in net profit in 2025 as compared to 2024. The quarterly consolidated financial data shows fluctuations in revenue and net profit. Revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 35,842.19 Crore, while net profit was Rs 8,589.95 Crore. title: Nippon Life India Asset Management shares rise 2.11%; stock among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Nippon Life India Asset Management's stock moved up by 2.11% to Rs 884.45 in today's session, making it one of the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150. At 11:21 am, the stock demonstrated positive momentum. Nippon Life India Asset Management's financial performance shows consistent growth. The consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 2,230.69 Crore, a notable increase compared to Rs 1,643.22 Crore in the previous year. The net profit also saw a rise, reaching Rs 1,285.73 Crore in March 2025, up from Rs 1,106.25 Crore in March 2024. title: Larsen & Toubro shares gain 1.19% in today's session; over 6.7 lakh shares traded
content: Shares of Larsen & Toubro were trading higher in Thursday's session, with the stock currently priced at Rs 3,634.90 on the NSE, a gain of 1.19% from the previous close. Over 6.7 lakh shares changed hands in today's session as of about 11.15 am. Trading Volume & Market Impact In today's trading session, over 6.7 lakh shares of Larsen & Toubro were traded on the NSE. Financial Performance Larsen & Toubro's consolidated financial performance shows consistent growth in revenue and net profit over the years. The company's annual revenue has increased steadily from Rs 135,979.03 Crore in 2021 to Rs 255,734.45 Crore in 2025. Similarly, the net profit has risen from Rs 4,668.96 Crore in 2021 to Rs 17,687.39 Crore in 2025. The quarterly financial results also reflect a positive trajectory. For the quarter-ending June 2025, Larsen & Toubro reported revenue of Rs 63,678.92 Crore and a net profit of Rs 4,325.57 Crore. title: Apollo Hospitals Enterprises share gain to hit 52-week high on NSE today
content: Shares of Apollo Hospitals Enterprises reached a 52-week high of Rs 7,918.00 on the NSE. At 10:58 am, the stock was trading at Rs 7,917.00, up 0.43% from its previous close. Financial Performance: Apollo Hospitals Enterprises has demonstrated consistent financial performance. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 5,842.10 Crore, compared to Rs 5,085.60 Crore in the quarter-ending June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 427.40 Crore, up from Rs 304.00 Crore in the previous year. The EPS increased to Rs 30.10 in the quarter-ending June 2025 from Rs 21.23 in the quarter-ending June 2024. Annual Performance: The company's annual consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 21,794.00 Crore, a significant increase from Rs 19,059.20 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. The net profit also rose substantially to Rs 1,472.10 Crore in the year-ending March 2025 from Rs 917.00 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. The EPS for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 100.56, compared to Rs 62.50 in the previous year. Earlier, an interim dividend of Rs 19.00 per share (1900%) and a special dividend of Rs 10.00 per share (1000%) were announced on October 10, 2024, and October 11, 2024, respectively, with an effective date of November 6, 2024. The company had a stock split on July 3, 2000, where the old face value of Rs 10 was split into a new face value of Rs 1. Bonus shares were issued on September 30, 1991, with an existing ratio of 2 and an offered ratio of 1; the ex-bonus date was July 19, 1991, with a bonus ratio of 1:2. Moneycontrol analysis, as of August 18, 2025, indicates very bullish sentiment on the stock. Hindustan Unilever shares were trading lower in today's session, with the stock currently priced at Rs 2,638.90, a decline of 1.16% from the previous close.

title: Real estate stocks jump up to 3%, extend gains for 4th day: What's driving the rally?
content: The shares of real estate companies recorded notable gains on August 21, buoyed by multiple factors. The sharp rise in the share prices pushed the Nifty Realty index up over 1 percent to hover around 923 in the morning. The realty index has now extended gains for the fourth consecutive session. Here are the likely triggers pushing the real estate stocks up: 'Listed developers are well-positioned for sustained growth': Listed residential developers delivered their strongest-ever quarter in Q1 of the financial year 2026, said Pankaj Kumar, VP-Fundamental Research, Kotak Securities. "With a robust ~Rs 1.8 lakh crore launch pipeline, strong balance sheets, and low leverage, listed developers are well-positioned for sustained growth and market share gains. Valuations for most residential real estate stocks stand at 7-10X adjusted EV/EBITDA (FY27E). Despite moderating industry volume trends, we remain constructive on listed developers, driven by geographical expansion and market share gains," he added. Kotak Securities named DLF, Brigade Enterprises, Lodha, and Prestige Estates as its preferred picks in the sector. Rate cut expectations: The Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) kept its repo rate unchanged during the last meeting in August. Repo rates directly influence home loan interest rates, affecting EMIs and loan costs. Hence, no rate cut had dampened sentiment in the sector, pushing the stocks down significantly earlier this month. However, several analysts now expect RBI to deliver a repo rate cut during its upcoming meeting scheduled for October. "While concerns of potential rising inflation in the U.S. is weighing on the market there, the bold reform initiatives in India and the sustained money flows into the market are imparting resilience to the market. With retail inflation in India remaining much lower than expected (1.55% in July) another rate cut by the MPC is possible soon even though the RBI is cautious in the context of heightened global uncertainty," said VK Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist at Geojit Investments. The expectations of a rate cut may have further fuelled the optimism in the real estate sector. GST reforms: While delivering his Independence Day speech, Prime Minister Narendra Modi hinted at the next generation of Goods and Services Tax (GST) reforms to be announced as a Diwali gift for consumers. The Centre has proposed to move towards "simple tax" with 2 slabs—"standard and merit", with special rates applicable for only for select few items. This will likely reduce tax burden on consumers, thereby increasing discretionary spending limit, which in turn may boost housing demand. Value buying: The sharp rise in the share prices also comes after a strong correction. After hitting a record high in June, the Nifty Realty index tumbled nearly 17 percent in just two months to hit a low of nearly 871 in August. The sharp correction may have made the stocks attractive for investors at the current levels. The index has now risen nearly 6 percent in eight sessions. Anant Raj shares were the top gainer on the index, rising more than 3 percent to trade at Rs 555 apiece. Prestige Estates and Sobha shares were up around 2 percent each, while Godrej Properties, Macrotech Developers (Lodha), DLF and Oberoi Realty shares gained around 1 percent each. Brigade Enterprises and Phoenix Mills shares were trading in the green with marginal gains. Bucking the trend, Raymond shares were down over 1 percent to trade at Rs 643 apiece. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.
summary_lexrank: The expectations of a rate cut may have further fuelled the optimism in the real estate sector.
summary_luhn: Here are the likely triggers pushing the real estate stocks up: 'Listed developers are well-positioned for sustained growth': Listed residential developers delivered their strongest-ever quarter in Q1 of the financial year 2026, said Pankaj Kumar, VP-Fundamental Research, Kotak Securities.
summary_lsa: Despite moderating industry volume trends, we remain constructive on listed developers, driven by geographical expansion and market share gains," he added.
summary_textrank: "While concerns of potential rising inflation in the U.S. is weighing on the market there, the bold reform initiatives in India and the sustained money flows into the market are imparting resilience to the market.

title: Top Nifty gainers: Dr Reddys Labs, Bharat Electronics, Cipla stocks lead on Nifty 50 index in today's trading
content: Dr Reddys Labs, Bharat Electronics, and Cipla stocks were among the top gainers on the Nifty 50 index in Thursday's trading session. At 11:00 am, Dr Reddys Labs was trading at Rs 1,263.80, a gain of 1.48%. Bharat Electronics followed, trading at Rs 377.05, up by 1.4%, while Cipla was trading at Rs 1,566.30 with a rise of 1.31%. Bajaj Finserv and Larsen also saw gains, trading at Rs 1,982.50 and Rs 3,634.00, reflecting increases of 1.23% and 1.16%, respectively. Dr Reddys Labs' financial performance shows consistent growth. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 4,439.74 Crore, compared to Rs 4,243.57 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 960.67 Crore, up from Rs 780.99 Crore in the previous year. The earnings per share (EPS) also increased from Rs 1.08 to Rs 1.33. title: Ola Electric shares fall 6.5%, stock among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150 today
content: Ola Electric shares experienced a significant decline in Thursday's trading session, with the stock falling 6.5% and identified as one of the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150. At 10:30 am, other notable losers on the Nifty Midcap 150 included Emami, Tube Investment, 360 ONE WAM, and J. K. Cement. Emami shares also saw a decrease, falling 1.4%, while Tube Investment shares declined by 1.28%. Similarly, 360 ONE WAM and J. K. Cement both experienced declines of 1.21% during the same period. Ola Electric Financials The financial performance of Ola Electric reveals the following trends based on consolidated quarterly data: Consolidated Quarterly Data:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 1,644.00 CroreRs 1,214.00 CroreRs 1,045.00 CroreRs 611.00 CroreRs 828.00 CroreNet Profit-Rs 347.00 Crore-Rs 495.00 Crore-Rs 564.00 Crore-Rs 870.00 Crore-Rs 428.00 CroreEPS-0.95-1.20-1.28-1.97-0.97The revenue for Ola Electric has fluctuated over the past five quarters, with a high of Rs 1,644 Crore in June 2024 and a low of Rs 611 Crore in March 2025. Net profit has been negative throughout this period, with the largest loss recorded in March 2025 at -Rs 870 Crore. Similarly, the EPS has been negative, reflecting the company's losses per share. Consolidated Yearly Data:Heading2022202320242025RevenueRs 373.42 CroreRs 2,630.93 CroreRs 5,009.83 CroreRs 4,514.00 CroreNet Profit-Rs 784.15 Crore-Rs 1,472.08 Crore-Rs 1,584.40 Crore-Rs 2,276.00 CroreEPS-2.23-3.91-4.35-5.48BVPS9.502.80-4.8811.66ROE-42.21-269.240.00-44.25Debt to Equity0.403.01-2.500.59The annual revenue for Ola Electric has shown significant growth from 2022 to 2024, increasing from Rs 373.42 Crore to Rs 5,009.83 Crore. However, there was a decrease in revenue in 2025 to Rs 4,514.00 Crore. Net profit has remained negative, with losses increasing from -Rs 784.15 Crore in 2022 to -Rs 2,276.00 Crore in 2025. The EPS follows a similar trend, with increasing negative values. title: Dabur India share price falls 2.02% in early trade
content: Dabur India shares experienced a decline of 2.02% in Thursday's early trading session, with the stock price reaching Rs 524.20. This movement reflects a notable shift in the stock's value compared to its previous close, positioning it among the declining stocks on the Nifty Next 50 index. Dabur India's financial performance reveals key insights into its revenue and profitability. Consolidated quarterly revenue figures show Rs 3,349.11 Crore for June 2024, Rs 3,028.59 Crore for September 2024, Rs 3,355.25 Crore for December 2024, Rs 2,830.14 Crore for March 2025, and Rs 3,404.58 Crore for June 2025. Net profit for these quarters stood at Rs 494.55 Crore, Rs 417.28 Crore, Rs 515.32 Crore, Rs 312.72 Crore, and Rs 508.69 Crore, respectively. Earnings per share (EPS) were reported as Rs 2.82, Rs 2.40, Rs 2.95, Rs 1.81, and Rs 2.90 for the same periods. The consolidated yearly financials provide further context. Revenue increased from Rs 9,546.60 Crore in 2021 to Rs 12,563.09 Crore in 2025. Net profit saw fluctuations, with Rs 1,695.96 Crore in 2021, rising to Rs 1,811.82 Crore in 2024, before settling at Rs 1,739.87 Crore in 2025. EPS followed a similar trend, moving from Rs 9.58 in 2021 to Rs 10.40 in 2024 and then to Rs 9.97 in 2025. Book Value Per Share (BVPS) consistently increased from Rs 43.57 in 2021 to Rs 60.94 in 2025. Return on Equity (ROE) decreased from 22.09% in 2021 to 16.36% in 2025, while the Debt to Equity ratio remained relatively stable, starting at 0.06 in 2021 and ending at 0.07 in 2025. Here is a summary of Dabur India's financial performance:Particulars20212022202320242025RevenueRs 9,546.60 CroreRs 10,888.68 CroreRs 11,529.89 CroreRs 12,404.01 CroreRs 12,563.09 CroreNet ProfitRs 1,695.96 CroreRs 1,744.10 CroreRs 1,702.96 CroreRs 1,811.82 CroreRs 1,739.87 CroreEPSRs 9.58Rs 9.84Rs 9.64Rs 10.40Rs 9.97BVPSRs 43.57Rs 47.64Rs 53.29Rs 58.14Rs 60.94ROE22.09%20.75%19.02%18.67%16.36%Debt to Equity0.060.100.110.120.07The income statement provides a detailed breakdown of Dabur India's financial activities. Sales for the year ending March 2025 were reported at Rs 12,563 Crore, compared to Rs 12,404 Crore for the year ending March 2024. Other income stood at Rs 550 Crore and Rs 482 Crore for the same periods, respectively. Total income reached Rs 13,113 Crore in March 2025, up from Rs 12,886 Crore in March 2024. Total expenditure was Rs 10,692 Crore in March 2025, against Rs 10,402 Crore in March 2024. Earnings Before Interest and Taxes (EBIT) were Rs 2,420 Crore and Rs 2,483 Crore, respectively. Interest expenses were Rs 163 Crore and Rs 124 Crore, while tax expenses were Rs 517 Crore and Rs 547 Crore. Net profit was Rs 1,739 Crore for the year ending March 2025, compared to Rs 1,811 Crore for the previous year. Quarterly figures also show fluctuations. Sales for June 2025 reached Rs 3,404 Crore, while net profit was Rs 508 Crore. These figures compare to sales of Rs 3,349 Crore and net profit of Rs 494 Crore for June 2024. Key balance sheet figures reveal the company’s financial structure. As of March 2025, share capital was Rs 177 Crore, with reserves and surplus at Rs 10,623 Crore. Current liabilities totaled Rs 4,318 Crore, and other liabilities were Rs 1,113 Crore, bringing total liabilities to Rs 16,232 Crore. Fixed assets amounted to Rs 3,753 Crore, current assets to Rs 6,532 Crore, and other assets to Rs 5,946 Crore, resulting in total assets of Rs 16,232 Crore. Contingent liabilities were reported at Rs 754 Crore. Cash flow data indicates that cash flow from operating activities was Rs 1,986 Crore in March 2025, while cash flow from investing activities was -Rs 449 Crore and from financing activities -Rs 1,405 Crore, resulting in net cash flow of Rs 133 Crore. Dabur India has announced several corporate actions. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 5.25 per share on May 7, 2025, with an effective date of July 18, 2025. Other recent dividends include an interim dividend of Rs 2.75 per share announced on October 17, 2024, and a final dividend of Rs 2.75 per share announced on May 2, 2024. The company has also issued bonus shares in the past, including a 1:1 bonus on July 26, 2010. A stock split was announced on November 3, 2000, with an ex-split date of November 27, 2000, changing the face value from Rs 10 to Rs 1. Moneycontrol analysis as of August 14, 2025, indicates a very bearish sentiment on the stock. With the stock currently trading at Rs 524.20, Dabur India has shown a decline of 2.02% in today's session, reflecting prevailing market dynamics.
summary_lexrank: Total income reached Rs 13,113 Crore in March 2025, up from Rs 12,886 Crore in March 2024.
summary_luhn: Cash flow data indicates that cash flow from operating activities was Rs 1,986 Crore in March 2025, while cash flow from investing activities was -Rs 449 Crore and from financing activities -Rs 1,405 Crore, resulting in net cash flow of Rs 133 Crore.
summary_lsa: With the stock currently trading at Rs 524.20, Dabur India has shown a decline of 2.02% in today's session, reflecting prevailing market dynamics.
summary_textrank: Consolidated quarterly revenue figures show Rs 3,349.11 Crore for June 2024, Rs 3,028.59 Crore for September 2024, Rs 3,355.25 Crore for December 2024, Rs 2,830.14 Crore for March 2025, and Rs 3,404.58 Crore for June 2025.

title: ITC shares trade flat in Thursday's session; check day's high and low

title: Nestle shares fall 1.28%, among top losers on Nifty 50
content: Nestle's stock experienced a decline of 1.28%, settling at Rs 1,175.10, emerging among the top losers on the Nifty 50 in Thursday's trading session. At 10:30 am, other notable Nifty 50 losers included TATA Cons. Prod, Coal India, HUL and IndusInd Bank. Nestle India Limited informed the Exchange regarding the allotment of 964157160 equity shares with a face value of Re 1 each as fully paid-up bonus equity shares, pursuant to the bonus issue at its meeting held on August 11, 2025. Nestle's recent financial results reveal a mixed performance. Consolidated quarterly revenue shows fluctuations, with Rs 4,813.95 Crore in June 2024, rising to Rs 5,104.00 Crore in September 2024, then decreasing to Rs 4,779.73 Crore in December 2024, before climbing to Rs 5,503.88 Crore in March 2025, and settling at Rs 5,096.16 Crore in June 2025. Net profit followed a similar pattern, with Rs 746.60 Crore in June 2024, increasing to Rs 903.21 Crore in September 2024, declining to Rs 695.82 Crore in December 2024, then rising to Rs 885.88 Crore in March 2025, and decreasing to Rs 659.23 Crore in June 2025. Earnings per share (EPS) also varied, with Rs 7.74 in June 2024, Rs 9.33 in September 2024, Rs 7.14 in December 2024, Rs 9.06 in March 2025, and Rs 6.71 in June 2025. The consolidated yearly revenue for 2024 was Rs 24,393.89 Crore, which decreased to Rs 20,201.56 Crore in 2025. The net profit also saw a decrease from Rs 3,932.84 Crore in 2024 to Rs 3,231.54 Crore in 2025. The EPS decreased from Rs 40.79 in 2024 to Rs 33.27 in 2025. Consolidated Income Statement (Yearly)ParticularsMar 2025Mar 2024SalesRs 20,201 CroreRs 24,393 CroreOther IncomeRs 58 CroreRs 147 CroreTotal IncomeRs 20,260 CroreRs 24,541 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 15,784 CroreRs 19,107 CroreEBITRs 4,476 CroreRs 5,434 CroreInterestRs 136 CroreRs 145 CroreTaxRs 1,108 CroreRs 1,356 CroreNet ProfitRs 3,231 CroreRs 3,932 Crore
summary_lexrank: Nestle's stock experienced a decline of 1.28%, settling at Rs 1,175.10, emerging among the top losers on the Nifty 50 in Thursday's trading session.
summary_luhn: Consolidated quarterly revenue shows fluctuations, with Rs 4,813.95 Crore in June 2024, rising to Rs 5,104.00 Crore in September 2024, then decreasing to Rs 4,779.73 Crore in December 2024, before climbing to Rs 5,503.88 Crore in March 2025, and settling at Rs 5,096.16 Crore in June 2025.

title: Max Healthcare Institute shares rise over 2% on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Max Healthcare Institute Limited were trading at Rs 1,251.50, a 2.11% increase from the previous close, in Thursday's session as of 10:32 am. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Financial Performance: Max Healthcare Institute Limited has demonstrated significant financial growth over the past few years. The consolidated annual revenue has increased consistently, reaching Rs 7,028.46 Crore for the year ending March 2025, compared to Rs 5,406.02 Crore in the previous year. Net profit also saw a rise, reaching Rs 1,075.88 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 1,057.64 Crore in March 2024. The company's earnings per share (EPS) increased to Rs 11.07 in March 2025 from Rs 10.89 in March 2024. The following table presents the consolidated annual financial data for key metrics:HeadingMar 2021Mar 2022Mar 2023Mar 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 2,504.67 CroreRs 3,931.46 CroreRs 4,562.60 CroreRs 5,406.02 CroreRs 7,028.46 CroreNet Profit-Rs 114.50 CroreRs 605.05 CroreRs 1,103.51 CroreRs 1,057.64 CroreRs 1,075.88 CroreEPS-Rs 1.59Rs 6.25Rs 11.38Rs 10.89Rs 11.07BVPSRs 58.37Rs 64.79Rs 76.31Rs 86.51Rs 96.50ROE-Rs 2.43Rs 9.63Rs 14.89Rs 12.57Rs 11.46Debt to EquityRs 0.16Rs 0.12Rs 0.08Rs 0.14Rs 0.27The consolidated quarterly revenue also showed an increasing trend. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 2,027.57 Crore, up from Rs 1,909.74 Crore in the quarter-ending March 2025. The net profit for the same period stood at Rs 307.97 Crore. The following table highlights the consolidated quarterly financials:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 1,542.95 CroreRs 1,707.46 CroreRs 1,868.31 CroreRs 1,909.74 CroreRs 2,027.57 CroreNet ProfitRs 236.27 CroreRs 281.81 CroreRs 238.80 CroreRs 319.00 CroreRs 307.97 CroreEPSRs 2.43Rs 2.90Rs 2.46Rs 3.28Rs 3.17Key financial ratios for Max Healthcare Institute Limited as of March 2025 include a basic EPS of Rs 11.07, diluted EPS of Rs 11.01 and a book value per share of Rs 96.50. The company's debt to equity ratio is 0.27, and the interest coverage ratio is 12.15. Corporate Actions: Max Healthcare Institute Limited has been actively involved in strategic developments. On August 13, 2025, the company announced an agreement to lease for establishing a ~130 bedded built-to-suit hospital at Dehradun, Uttarakhand. Additionally, the company released its earnings update presentation for the quarter ended June 30, 2025, highlighting a 27% year-over-year revenue growth. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 1.50 per share (15%) on May 20, 2025, with an effective date of July 4, 2025. A Moneycontrol analysis on August 14, 2025, indicated bearish sentiment on the stock. Shares of Max Healthcare Institute Limited were trading at Rs 1,251.50, a 2.11% increase from the previous close, in Thursday's session.

title: Tata Consultancy Services share price trades marginally higher in today's session
content: Shares of Tata Consultancy Services were trading higher at Rs 3,103.40 on Thursday. At 10:30 am, the stock showed a marginal increase of 0.15% on the NSE. The stock touched a day's high of Rs 3,130 and a day's low of Rs 3,083.10. Financial Snapshot: Tata Consultancy Services' consolidated financial performance shows consistent growth over the past five years. The company's annual revenue has steadily increased, reaching Rs 255,324 Crore for the year ending March 2025. Net profit has also seen a rise, with Rs 48,797 Crore reported for the same period. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) has grown to Rs 134.19 in March 2025. Quarterly Performance: The consolidated quarterly financial data reveals a similar upward trend. (x)1.201.160.911.151.25Corporate Actions Grasim Industries announced a final dividend of Rs.10.00 per share (500%) on May 22, 2025, with an effective date of August 12, 2025. Other corporate actions include intimation of schedule of Analysts / Institutional Investor Meet, Intimation under Regulations 33 and 47 of SEBI (LODR) Regulation, 2015 and Audio Recording - Earnings Call. The company had also announced bonus issue on February 11, 1988, with bonus ratio of 3:4 and exbonus date as October 18, 1988. Grasim Industries had rights issue with announce date as October 16, 2023, existing ratio as 179 and offered ratio as 6. The exrights date was January 10, 2024. A stock split was announced on August 11, 2016, with an exsplit date of October 6, 2016, changing the face value from Rs 10 to Rs 2. Moneycontrol analysis on August 14, 2025, indicated a bullish sentiment on the stock. Grasim Industries is included as one of the stocks in the benchmark Nifty 50 index. With the stock's last traded price at Rs 2,896.60, Grasim Industries has marked a new all-time high in today's session.

title: Thermax shares fall 1.08% amid volume surge on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Thermax declined 1.08% to Rs 3,198.50 in Thursday's session, accompanied by high volume. The stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. Thermax's consolidated financial performance reveals the following: Quarterly Results: The company's quarterly revenue and net profit are detailed in the table below:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 2,184.41 CroreRs 2,611.59 CroreRs 2,507.76 CroreRs 3,084.93 CroreRs 2,150.18 CroreNet ProfitRs 109.84 CroreRs 198.03 CroreRs 114.23 CroreRs 204.84 CroreRs 151.63 CroreEPS10.2817.4910.2918.2713.53The revenue for the quarter ending March 2025 stood at Rs 3,084.93 Crore, which is higher compared to the previous quarters. The net profit for the same period was Rs 204.84 Crore. In the quarter ending June 2025, revenue was Rs 2,150.18 Crore and net profit was Rs 151.63 Crore. Annual Results: The company's annual revenue, net profit, and other key financial metrics are presented below:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 4,791.25 CroreRs 6,128.33 CroreRs 8,089.81 CroreRs 9,323.46 CroreRs 10,388.69 CroreNet ProfitRs 206.58 CroreRs 312.18 CroreRs 450.93 CroreRs 644.01 CroreRs 626.94 CroreEPS18.3427.7339.9857.3056.33BVPS288.76310.17343.71394.30438.25ROE6.358.9411.6414.5312.85Debt to Equity0.090.100.210.280.34The annual revenue for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 10,388.69 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 9,323.46 Crore in the previous year. However, the net profit decreased slightly from Rs 644.01 Crore in 2024 to Rs 626.94 Crore in 2025. The company’s debt-to-equity ratio has also increased, standing at 0.34 for the year ending March 2025. title: ITC share price at ₹406.35, trades flat in today's session
content: Shares of ITC were trading marginally higher in Thursday's session, with the stock currently priced at Rs 406.35 on the NSE. This represents a gain of 0.07% from the previous close. The stock touched a day's high of Rs 406.85 and a day's low of Rs 404.70. Financial Performance: ITC's financial performance reveals the following trends: Quarterly Results: For the quarter ended June 2025, ITC reported a consolidated revenue of Rs 21,494.79 Crore, a notable increase compared to the Rs 18,457.33 Crore reported for the quarter ended June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 5,274.65 Crore, up from Rs 5,169.37 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) stood at Rs 4.19 for June 2025, compared to Rs 4.08 for June 2024. Annual Results: The company's consolidated revenue for the year ended March 2025 was Rs 75,323.34 Crore, an increase from Rs 70,881.00 Crore in the previous year. The net profit stood at Rs 19,926.05 Crore for the year ended March 2025, compared to Rs 20,723.75 Crore for the year ended March 2024. The EPS increased from Rs 16.42 in March 2024 to Rs 27.79 in March 2025. title: ITC shares trade flat in today's session; over 38.7 lakh shares traded
content: ITC shares were trading at Rs 406.30 on the NSE, a marginal rise of 0.06% from the previous close, as of 10:20 am. Over 38.7 lakh shares were traded in today's session. Financial Snapshot: ITC's consolidated financial performance highlights are as follows:Revenue: The company's consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 21,494.79 Crore, compared to Rs 18,765.00 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. The revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 75,323.34 Crore, up from Rs 70,881.00 Crore in the previous year.Net Profit: The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 5,274.65 Crore, compared to Rs 19,709.47 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 19,926.05 Crore.EPS: The Earnings Per Share (EPS) for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 4.19, compared to Rs 15.77 for the quarter-ending March 2025. The EPS for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 27.79.The following table presents a detailed view of ITC's consolidated quarterly financials:ParticularsJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025Revenue (Rs Crore)18,457.3319,990.3618,790.1718,765.0021,494.79Net Profit (Rs Crore)5,169.375,050.285,009.0819,709.475,274.65EPS4.083.993.9515.774.19The following table presents a detailed view of ITC's consolidated yearly financials:Particulars20212022202320242025Revenue (Rs Crore)49,272.7860,668.0970,936.8570,881.0075,323.34Net Profit (Rs Crore)13,389.8015,485.6519,427.6820,723.7519,926.05EPS10.7012.3715.5016.4227.79BVPS49.3150.9855.9559.9955.96ROE21.8024.4027.7527.4549.61Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00ITC reported annual sales of Rs 75,323 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 70,881 Crore in the previous year. Other income stood at Rs 2,529 Crore, and total expenditure amounted to Rs 50,991 Crore. The EBIT was Rs 26,861 Crore, and after accounting for interest (Rs 45 Crore) and tax (Rs 6,890 Crore), the net profit was Rs 19,926 Crore. Corporate Actions: ITC has announced several corporate actions, including:Allotment of Shares under the Employee Stock Option Schemes of the Company on August 19, 2025.Publication of Notice regarding Re-lodgement of Transfer Requests for Shares of ITC Limited held in Physical Form on August 12, 2025.Media Statement and Investor Presentation for Q1 FY 2025-26, released on August 1, 2025.The company announced a final dividend of Rs 7.85 per share (785%) with an effective date of May 28, 2025, and an interim dividend of Rs 6.50 per share (650%) with an effective date of February 12, 2025. title: Hindustan Unilever shares decline 1.08% in today's session; over 5.29 lakh shares traded
content: Hindustan Unilever shares were trading lower in Thursday's session, with the stock priced at Rs 2,641. The stock experienced a decline of 1.08% from its previous close, with over 5.29 lakh shares traded. In terms of quarterly financial performance, Hindustan Unilever's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 16,514 Crore, compared to Rs 15,707 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 2,769 Crore, up from Rs 2,614 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The earnings per share (EPS) increased to Rs 11.73 in June 2025 from Rs 11.11 in June 2024. The consolidated yearly financials reveal a steady increase in revenue and net profit. Revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 63,121 Crore, compared to Rs 61,896 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 10,679 Crore, up from Rs 10,286 Crore. The company's EPS also rose from Rs 43.74 in March 2024 to Rs 45.32 in March 2025. The book value per share (BVPS) stood at Rs 210.22 in March 2025, and the return on equity (ROE) was 21.55%. Consolidated Yearly Income Statement:Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021Sales63,121 Crore61,896 Crore60,580 Crore52,446 Crore47,028 CroreOther Income1,017 Crore811 Crore512 Crore258 Crore410 CroreTotal Income64,138 Crore62,707 Crore61,092 Crore52,704 Crore47,438 CroreTotal Expenditure49,320 Crore48,443 Crore47,632 Crore40,724 Crore36,715 CroreEBIT14,818 Crore14,264 Crore13,460 Crore11,980 Crore10,723 CroreInterest395 Crore334 Crore114 Crore106 Crore117 CroreTax3,744 Crore3,644 Crore3,201 Crore2,987 Crore2,606 CroreNet Profit10,679 Crore10,286 Crore10,145 Crore8,887 Crore8,000 CroreThe sales increased by 2.0% from Rs 61,896 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 63,121 Crore in March 2025. Similarly, net profit saw an increase of 3.8% from Rs 10,286 Crore to Rs 10,679 Crore during the same period. Consolidated Quarterly Income Statement:Jun 2025Mar 2025Dec 2024Sep 2024Jun 2024Sales16,514 Crore15,670 Crore15,818 Crore15,926 Crore15,707 CroreOther Income201 Crore309 Crore232 Crore219 Crore257 CroreTotal Income16,715 Crore15,979 Crore16,050 Crore16,145 Crore15,964 CroreTotal Expenditure13,284 Crore12,536 Crore11,957 Crore12,487 Crore12,340 CroreEBIT3,431 Crore3,443 Crore4,093 Crore3,658 Crore3,624 CroreInterest127 Crore80 Crore112 Crore110 Crore93 CroreTax535 Crore887 Crore993 Crore947 Crore917 CroreNet Profit2,769 Crore2,476 Crore2,988 Crore2,601 Crore2,614 CroreThe company announced a final dividend of Rs 24 per share (2400%) on April 24, 2025, with an effective date of June 23, 2025. Other dividends declared include an interim dividend of Rs 19 per share (1900%) and a special dividend of Rs 10 per share (1000%), both with an effective date of November 6, 2024. The company has a history of bonus issues, including a 1:2 bonus ratio announced on September 30, 1991, with an ex-bonus date of July 19, 1991. Additionally, Hindustan Unilever had a stock split on July 5, 2000, where the face value changed from Rs 10 to Rs 1. Hindustan Unilever is included as one of the stocks in the benchmark Nifty 50 index. With the stock currently trading at Rs 2,641, Hindustan Unilever experienced a dip of 1.08% from its previous close in today's session.

title: Tata Consultancy Services shares fall marginally; over 9.4 lakh shares traded
content: Shares of Tata Consultancy Services were trading at Rs 3,095.30 on the NSE at 10:20 am, a marginal decline of 0.11% from the previous close. Over 9.4 lakh shares changed hands in today's session. Trading Volume & Market Impact The traded volume for Tata Consultancy Services shares on the NSE reached 942,519 shares. Recent Financial Performance Tata Consultancy Services' consolidated financial performance reveals consistent growth in revenue and net profit. The company's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 63,437 Crore, up from Rs 62,613 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same quarter was Rs 12,819 Crore, compared to Rs 12,105 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The consolidated annual revenue for the year-ending March 2025 reached Rs 255,324 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 240,893 Crore in the previous year. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 48,797 Crore, up from Rs 46,099 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. Earnings per share (EPS) also increased from Rs 125.88 in March 2024 to Rs 134.19 in March 2025. Key financial figures are summarized below:ParticularsJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 62,613.00 CroreRs 64,259.00 CroreRs 63,973.00 CroreRs 64,479.00 CroreRs 63,437.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 12,105.00 CroreRs 11,955.00 CroreRs 12,444.00 CroreRs 12,293.00 CroreRs 12,819.00 CroreEPS33.2832.9234.2133.7935.27 Particulars20212022202320242025RevenueRs 164,177.00 CroreRs 191,754.00 CroreRs 225,458.00 CroreRs 240,893.00 CroreRs 255,324.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 32,562.00 CroreRs 38,449.00 CroreRs 42,303.00 CroreRs 46,099.00 CroreRs 48,797.00 CroreEPS86.71103.62115.19125.88134.19BVPS235.43245.48249.20252.26261.76ROE37.5242.9946.6150.7351.24Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00 The annual income statement shows consistent growth. Sales increased from Rs 164,177 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 255,324 Crore in March 2025. Other income also rose, from Rs 3,134 Crore to Rs 3,962 Crore over the same period. Total expenditure grew from Rs 122,914 Crore to Rs 193,159 Crore. Consequently, net profit increased from Rs 32,562 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 48,797 Crore in March 2025. The company’s balance sheet for March 2025 shows a share capital of Rs 362 Crore and reserves & surplus of Rs 94,394 Crore. Total assets and total liabilities both stand at Rs 159,629 Crore. Corporate Actions Tata Consultancy Services has announced several press releases. On August 20, 2025, the company announced a partnership with Finnish Retailer Kesko to drive AI-Powered Retail Transformation. Additionally, the company launched a new AI-enhanced Operations Center in Latin America on August 19, 2025. The company has also announced multiple dividends. A final dividend of Rs 30.00 per share was announced on April 11, 2025, with an effective date of June 4, 2025. An interim dividend of Rs 11.00 per share was announced on June 27, 2025, effective July 16, 2025. The company issued a special dividend of Rs 66.00 per share on January 9, 2025, effective January 17, 2025. Tata Consultancy Services issued bonus shares three times in the past. The company issued bonus shares on April 19, 2018(record date was on June 2, 2018 and ex date was May 31, 2018), April 20, 2009 (record date was on June 17, 2009 and ex date was June 16, 2009) and April 17, 2006 (record date was on July 31, 2006 and ex date was July 28, 2006). The bonus ratio was 1:1 for all instances. Market Outlook & Investor Sentiment Moneycontrol analysis on August 20, 2025, indicated a bearish sentiment for Tata Consultancy Services. With the stock currently trading at Rs 3,095.30, Tata Consultancy Services saw over 9.4 lakh shares traded in today's session.
summary_lexrank: The company's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 63,437 Crore, up from Rs 62,613 Crore in June 2024.

summary_lsa: With the stock currently trading at Rs 3,095.30, Tata Consultancy Services saw over 9.4 lakh shares traded in today's session.
summary_textrank: The net profit for the same quarter was Rs 12,819 Crore, compared to Rs 12,105 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year.

title: Solar Industries India shares rise 2.07%, among top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Solar Industries India shares gained 2.07% to trade at Rs 14,763.00 in Thursday's session, driven by positive investor activity. The stock was among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150 index at 10:29 am. Financial Performance: Solar Industries India has demonstrated strong financial performance, as evidenced by its consolidated annual results. The company's revenue for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 7,540.26 Crore, a significant increase compared to Rs 6,069.52 Crore in the previous year. Net profit also saw a substantial rise, reaching Rs 1,282.38 Crore in March 2025, up from Rs 874.88 Crore in March 2024. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) increased from Rs 92.38 in 2024 to Rs 133.65 in 2025. Similarly, net profit increased from Rs 874.88 crore in 2024 to Rs 1,282.38 crore in 2025. Quarterly Performance: The consolidated quarterly results also reflect a positive trajectory. Revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at Rs 2,154.45 Crore, up from Rs 1,694.78 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 352.56 Crore, compared to Rs 298.47 Crore in the previous year. Corporate Actions: Solar Industries India has announced several corporate actions, including transcripts and audio recordings of earnings conference calls related to the unaudited financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. The company also declared a final dividend of Rs 10 per share (500%) with an effective date of July 8, 2025. Previously, a final dividend of Rs 8.50 per share (425%) was declared with an effective date of July 4, 2024. title: Infosys shares marginally down; over 16.9 lakh shares traded
content: Shares of Infosys were trading flat in Thursday's session, with the stock currently priced at Rs 1,494.60 on the Nifty 50. As of 10:20 am, the stock experienced a marginal decrease of 0.11% from its previous close; over 16.9 lakh shares changed hands. Financial Snapshot: Infosys has demonstrated steady financial performance over the recent years. Here's a look at the company's key financial figures: Consolidated Quarterly Performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 39,315.00 CroreRs 40,986.00 CroreRs 41,764.00 CroreRs 40,925.00 CroreRs 42,279.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 6,374.00 CroreRs 6,516.00 CroreRs 6,822.00 CroreRs 7,038.00 CroreRs 6,924.00 CroreEPS15.3815.7116.4316.9816.70The revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at Rs 42,279.00 Crore, marking an increase from Rs 39,315.00 Crore in June 2024. content: Shares of Mankind Pharma gained 2.29% to trade at Rs 2,564.10 in Thursday's session. The stock is among the top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150 at 10:30 am. Financial Snapshot: The following table presents Mankind Pharma's consolidated quarterly financial performance:ParticularsJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 2,893.42 CroreRs 3,076.51 CroreRs 3,230.00 CroreRs 3,079.37 CroreRs 3,570.35 CroreNet ProfitRs 539.16 CroreRs 656.31 CroreRs 381.08 CroreRs 422.33 CroreRs 441.45 CroreEPS13.3916.319.4510.2010.62The company's revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at Rs 3,570.35 Crore, marking an increase compared to previous quarters. title: Prince Pipes rallies 6 percent on improved outlook, Motilal Oswal says sector on the cusp of recovery
content: Shares of Prince Pipes are sharply higher by 6 percent in trade after a Motilal Oswal note said on August 21 that the sector is poised for recovery following DGTR's recent recommendation for an anti-dumping duty and prices of PVC stabilizing at lower levels. MOSL in its note observed that the companies in the sector are looking ripe for a volume recovery in the July-August period, and are retaining their FY26 guidance as the demand outlook seems to be improving. "Though 1QFY26 was weighed down by weak macros, muted demand, and inventory losses from PVC volatility, we expect the PVC pipes industry to see a gradual recovery from 2QFY26 (on a low base), with a further pickup in momentum from 2HFY26," said the MOSL note. This recovery is likely to be supported by improving PVC prices, which will lead to restocking, supported by Centre's infrastructure push and improving housing demand. Prince Pipes had posted a muted quarter as volatile pricing and the early monsoon had dampened demand. The management has anticipated a gradual demand recovery for the rest of FY26, with a high single-to-low double-digit volume growth for the year. The bathware segment is expected to generate Rs 50-60 crore in revenue and could break-even by mid-FY27, according to the company, with plans of expasion in the southern and eastern markets in this segment. The company is expanding its eighth manufacturing facility which is expected to be completed by Q2FY26. "We expect Prince Pipes to clock 14%/37%/71% CAGR in revenue/EBITDA/PAT over FY25-28. We value the stock at 30x FY27 EPS to arrive at our target of Rs 440," said MOSL. Read More The PVC pipe industry is coming out of a year that saw inflationary pressures and subdued demand across segments, with a reduction in government's infrastructure spending, leading to caution in inventory optimization by channel partners. An increased volatility in PVC resin prices too dampened volume growth and profitability across the industry. Going forward, the management is confident of 'high single-digit to low double-digit' growth for the rest of the year. Prince Pipes also said it is focusing on geographical expansion and innovation to navigate the market uncertainties. "Looking ahead, we are optimistic about a gradual recovery in demand, supported by the government's renewed thrust on infrastructure spending," Parag Chheda, Joint MD of Price Pipes said during the June quarter earnings call. The stock is down 19 percent on a YTD basis but has rebounded by close to 18 percent in the last five trading sessions. Prince Pipes has a near 5 percent share in PVC pipes segment and is among the top six players in the industry that is increasingly getting organised. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Jupiter Wagons shares surge up to 13% on receiving LoI for Vande Bharat wheelsets
content: Jupiter Wagons shares snapped previous day's losses to surge up to 13 percent in August 21 trading session after the company received Letter of Interest (LoI) for an order worth Rs 215 crore for supply of Vande Bharat wheelsets. Shares of Jupiter Wagons touched an intraday high of Rs 371.80 per share on the NSE, rising 12.72 percent. The stock had opened with a gain of 6.11 percent today and continued its upward trajectory. The company in an exchange filing, said "Jupiter Tatravagonka Railwheel Factory Private Limited, has received a Letter of Intent (LOI) dated 19th August 2025, for supply of total 5,376 wheelsets for Vande Bharat Train for an order value of approximately Rs. 215 crores." title: Newly-listed Shanti Gold shares rally 11% after Q1 net profit surges 174% to Rs 25 crore
content: The newly-listed shares of Shanti Gold International surged nearly 11 percent on August 21 after the company released its results for the first quarter of the financial year 2026. The shares of the company were trading at Rs 274 apiece in the morning, the highest level seen by the stock so far since listing. Shanti Gold International on August 20 reported a net profit of Rs 24.6 crore for the April-June quarter of the ongoing financial year 2026. This marks a whopping 174 percent year-on-year (YoY) jump from the Rs 8.99 crore net profit reported in the corresponding quarter of the previous financial year. The firm's revenue from operations rose 22 percent YoY to Rs 292.78 crore in Q1 FY26 from Rs 239.83 crore in Q1 FY25. Expenses meanwhile rose around 14 percent YoY to Rs 261 crore during the quarter under review. Shanti Gold International had released its first-ever results after market debut in the post market hours of August 20. The shares of the company had made a decent debut on stock markets on August 1, listing at Rs 227.55 per share on NSE. This marked a premium of over 14 percent over its IPO price of Rs 199 per share. The shares of the company have so far jumped more than 20 percent from the listing price, and are up nearly 38 percent from the IPO price. The stock currently has a P/E ratio of around 72. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. title: Hexaware Technologies shares rally 4% as Nuvama initiates with buy; 23% upside seen
content: Shares of Hexaware Technologies rose 4 percent to Rs 807 on Thursday after Nuvama Institutional Equities initiated coverage on the stock with a ‘buy’ rating and a target price of Rs 950 per share, citing strong growth prospects and an attractive valuation following the recent correction. The price target implies an upside potential of 23 percent from the last close. The brokerage noted that Hexaware, with annual revenue of USD 1.4 billion, is well-placed within the mid-cap IT universe to outpace larger peers in the coming years. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates It expects the company to deliver an 11 percent revenue CAGR in dollar terms between CY24 and CY27, supported by its diversified vertical presence, coveted client base and robust cash flow profile. Margin expansion of about 250 basis points is also expected to drive a 19 percent CAGR in EBIT and an 18 percent CAGR in earnings per share over the same period. Hexaware’s positioning in the USD 1–5 billion revenue zone gives it the ability to pursue larger deals while retaining growth flexibility, Nuvama said. The company has a strong presence in BFSI, manufacturing, professional services, hi-tech, travel and healthcare, and works with 31 Fortune 500 clients. Its client relationships remain sticky, with the average tenure of its top 5, 10 and 20 customers standing at 15, 15 and 12 years, respectively. On the margins front, Hexaware has historically maintained EBITDA levels of 15–16 percent, though recent years were affected by exceptional costs. With ERP transformation and other one-off expenses set to taper off by H2CY25, Nuvama expects margins to improve gradually, reaching 17.4 percent by CY27. According to the brokerage, the recent decline in Hexaware’s stock after soft Q2CY25 earnings has created a favourable entry point. “The CMP offers an excellent opportunity to own a high-quality business at an inexpensive valuation,” it said, adding that the stock trades at 28x and 24x its CY26 and CY27 earnings, in line with peers such as LTIMindtree and Mphasis. At about 10 am, shares of the company were trading at Rs 795, higher by 2.8 percent from the last close on the NSE. Hexaware Tech shares have risen 11 percent in one week. title: Interglobe Aviation shares slip 2% as Kotak downgrades stock to "add" amid capacity cuts
content: Shares of InterGlobe Aviation, the operator of IndiGo, fell 2 percent to Rs 6,010 apiece on August 21 after Kotak Institutional Equities downgraded the stock to “add”, even as it maintained a target price of Rs 6,850, implying an upside potential of 14 percent from current levels. Kotak noted that recent data indicates the impact of IndiGo’s capacity cuts, which seem to be occurring at a slightly faster pace than its key competitor. However, the brokerage clarified, “We would not take this as a sign of weakening demand.” According to Kotak, the airline is phasing out damp leases and possibly deferring new aircraft deliveries during what is traditionally a loss-making quarter. Unlike its earlier approach of adding capacity in Q2 ahead of strong Q3 and Q4 demand, IndiGo is now focusing on measures to support yield growth during the festive season. Catch all the market action on our LIVE blog Kotak further highlighted that airlines aim to avoid setting low yields as the new norm, particularly when most carriers are operating at a loss. Despite falling crude prices, yields have remained flat for the past three years, which Kotak described as a “commendable feat.” The brokerage expects carriers to push for year-on-year yield growth in the upcoming festive season. As part of its capacity adjustments, IndiGo has reduced its average monthly flight count to around 2,000 for the current months, representing a decline of 11 percent compared to Q4FY25 and 9 percent compared to Q1FY26. By comparison, Air India has reduced its flights by 10 percent and 8 percent, respectively. For the June quarter, IndiGo reported a net profit of Rs 2,176 crore, down 20.2 percent from Rs 2,728 crore in the corresponding period last year. Revenue rose 4.7 percent year-on-year to Rs 20,496 crore, but missed the estimated Rs 21,150 crore. EBITDA increased marginally by 1 percent year-on-year to Rs 5,226 crore, while the operating margin slipped to 25.5 percent from 26.4 percent a year earlier. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

summary_luhn: EBITDA increased marginally by 1 percent year-on-year to Rs 5,226 crore, while the operating margin slipped to 25.5 percent from 26.4 percent a year earlier.

title: Godrej Properties rises 2% as it secures Hyderabad land parcel with Rs 3,800 crore revenue potential
content: Shares of Godrej Properties gained as much as 2.2 percent to Rs 2,082 in morning trade on Thursday, August 21, after it announced it has secured the top spot in an e-auction conducted by the Telangana Housing Board (TGHB), emerging as the highest bidder for a 7.8-acre residential land parcel in Hyderabad’s Kukatpally area. The real estate developer placed a combined bid of Rs 547.78 crore for the plot, which is estimated to generate a revenue potential of nearly Rs 3,800 crore. The allotment letter will be issued once TGHB completes the necessary formalities, the company said in a stock exchange filing on August 21. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates Located close to HITEC City, the project will feature premium residential apartments across multiple configurations. "Following the strong response to our recent launch, Godrej Madison Avenue at Kokapet, our presence in Kukatpally enables us to deliver large-scale, future-ready developments while creating long-term value for our residents," said Gaurav Pandey, MD and CEO of Godrej Properties. The announcement comes a day after the company disclosed the purchase of a 7 percent stake in Godrej Skyline Developers (GSDL) for Rs 9.25 lakh. Under the agreement, Godrej Properties will acquire 92,500 equity shares of Rs 10 each from existing shareholders, with the deal slated for completion on August 21. Also read: HAL confirms Rs 62,000-crore mega order for 97 LCA Mk-1A fighter jets: Report For the June quarter, Godrej Properties reported a 15.4 percent year-on-year rise in net profit to Rs 600 crore, though revenue slipped 41 percent to Rs 435 crore. The company also posted an EBITDA loss of Rs 243 crore. Earlier this month, the developer outlined an ambitious growth plan for FY26, targeting sales of Rs 32,500 crore and collections of around Rs 21,000 crore. The company’s net debt rose 42 percent to Rs 4,637 crore as it ramps up expansion to tap into robust housing demand. In the June quarter, Godrej Properties added five new land parcels to its portfolio, with an estimated development potential of Rs 11,400 crore. At about 9:30 am, shares of the company were trading at Rs 2,080, higher by 1.8 percent from the last close on the NSE. Godrej Properties shares are down 27 percent since the beginning of the year. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: India Cements shares jump 5% as UltraTech's OFS to sell 6.5% stake opens today
content: The shares of India Cements jumped nearly 5 percent in the early trading hours of August 21, as promoter UltraTech Cement's offer for sale (OFS) to sell up to 2.01 crore shares in the company opened for bidding. India Cements shares were trading at around Rs 388 apiece. UltraTech Cement on August 20 announced that its board has approved the plan to sell up to 2.01 crore shares of India Cements, representing 6.49 percent stake in the company. The stake sale will be done through an offer for sale (OFS), the cement company added. The floor price for the stake sale has been set at Rs 368 per share and the offer window will remain open from August 21 to August 22. At the given floor price, the maximum value of the stake sale would stand at over Rs 740 crore. In an exchange filing released in the post market hours of August 20, UltraTech Cement said, "We wish to inform you that the Committee of Directors and Officers of UltraTech Cement Limited ('MPS Committee'), at its meeting held today i.e. 20th August, 2025, has approved the sale of up to 2,01,12,330 equity shares of The India Cements Limited ('ICEM'), representing 6.49% of the issued and paid-up equity share capital of ICEM, by way of an offer for sale through the stock exchange mechanism, in accordance with applicable laws and the circulars issued by the Securities and Exchange Board of India and the stock exchanges." UltraTech Cement held 81.49 percent stake in India Cements at the end of the June quarter of financial year 2026. After the stake sale, UltraTech Cement will hold 75 percent stake in the company. UltraTech Cement had announced the acquisition of a 32.72 percent stake in India Cements from promoters and their associates in a Rs 3,954 crore deal in July 2024. Besides, it had also announced a Rs 3,142.35 crore open offer to acquire 26 percent stake of ICL from its shareholders. Competition Commission of India in December approved UltraTech Cements acquisition of India Cements, following which the Aditya Birla Group-company became a majority shareholder of its Southern cement peer. UltraTech Cement shares were trading in the red with marginal losses. The stock was down 0.3 percent to trade at Rs 12,835 apiece, as seen at 9.30 am. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates

title: Sensex, Nifty rally for 6th straight session as metals, oil & gas gain; IT stocks drag
content: Benchmark indices Nifty and Sensex gained for a sixth consecutive session on the bourses on Thursday, August 21, as bank and metal stocks rose in the opening trade. In the broader market, trade began on a mixed note with midcaps slipping, even as smallcaps outpaced the benchmark indices. At about 9:25 am, the Sensex was up 97.89 points or 0.12 percent at 81,955.73, and the Nifty was up 16.00 points or 0.06 percent at 25,066.55. About 1777 shares advanced, 1039 shares declined, and 144 shares were unchanged. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates "The Indian market sustained its positive momentum, supported by strong domestic inflows and favourable macro tailwinds. However, rich valuations and external risks, particularly the U.S. tariffs and sanctions on the purchase of Russian crude, continue to pose challenges. Hence, greater visibility on U.S. trade policy and the path of earnings recovery will be critical," says Vinod Nair of Geojit Investments Ltd. Among individual stocks, Godrej Properties gained as much as 2 percent after it announced it has secured the top spot in an e-auction conducted by the Telangana Housing Board (TGHB), emerging as the highest bidder for a 7.8-acre residential land parcel in Hyderabad’s Kukatpally area. The area is estimated to generate a revenue potential of nearly Rs 3,800 crore. Shares of chemical player Clean Science and Technology Limited tanked over 6 percent as the promoters offloaded 20 percent stake in the firm, according to reports. The sellers of the promoter group, namely Ashok Ramnarayan Boob and family and Krishnakumar Ramnarayan Boob and family are looking to dilute up to 24 percent stake as part of the proposed trade. The sale is likely to raise Rs 2,626 crore or $302 million dollars, with the floor price at Rs 1,030 apiece. This is a 13 percent discount to the previous session's closing price. India Cements Ltd., now a subsidiary of India's largest cement company, UltraTech Cement Ltd, rose over 3 percent ahead of the Offer For Sale (OFS) from its parent company. UltraTech's board on Wednesday has approved the sale of a 6.49 percent stake in India Cements through the Offer for Sale (OFS) process. Floor price of the OFS has been fixed at Rs 368 per share. Technical View Nifty continues to exhibit resilience, led by strength in IT counters, while sustaining above the 25,000 mark has confirmed follow-through bullish momentum. Notably, major call writers have begun shifting their positions to higher strikes, adding further conviction to the bullish structure. A sustained push beyond 25,100 is likely to reignite strong upward momentum towards 25,250, forcing significant call writers into short-covering, thereby accelerating gains. On the flip side, support zones have shifted higher, with dips toward 24,800 expected to attract accumulation. Firm positioning by Put writers near at-the-money strikes lends additional support to this constructive view. Unless the index decisively breaches 24,770, the bulls are expected to retain the upper hand. For now, a “buy-on-dips” strategy remains the most prudent play, with traders eyeing a breakout above 25,200 to confirm the next leg of upside momentum. SBI Life Insurance, Bajaj Finserv, Reliance Industries, Shriram Finance, and Trent were the top gainers on the Nifty. Laggards on the index included Coal India, HUL, Tata Consumer Products, JSW Steel, and Asian Paints. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

summary_luhn: At about 9:25 am, the Sensex was up 97.89 points or 0.12 percent at 81,955.73, and the Nifty was up 16.00 points or 0.06 percent at 25,066.55.
summary_lsa: Technical View Nifty continues to exhibit resilience, led by strength in IT counters, while sustaining above the 25,000 mark has confirmed follow-through bullish momentum.

title: RailTel Corp shares jump 4% as it secures multiple orders worth over Rs 50 crore
content: Shares of RailTel Corporation of India jumped 4 percent to Rs 373 on August 21 after the company announced securing multiple orders cumulatively worth over Rs 50 crore. The public sector enterprise received an order of Rs 34.99 crore from the Kerala State Information Technology Mission and another order of Rs 15.42 crore from the Higher Education Department of Odisha. Catch all the market action on our LIVE blog Under the Kerala order, RailTel will provide data centre operation services and maintenance of the State Data Centres for a period of five years. The Odisha order involves design and development of CMS-based bilingual websites for colleges under the state’s Higher Education Department. RailTel, among India’s largest neutral telecom infrastructure providers, operates an extensive fiber optic network of over 62,000 kilometres along railway tracks, supported by a 21,000-kilometre citywide network. For the first quarter, RailTel posted a 36 percent rise in net profit to Rs 66 crore, compared to Rs 49 crore in the year-ago period. Revenue from operations surged 33 percent to Rs 744 crore, against Rs 558 crore a year earlier. The company’s EBITDA stood at Rs 116 crore, up 11.5 percent from Rs 104 crore in the same quarter last year. However, the operating margin contracted to 15.6 percent from 18.6 percent in the previous year. So far this year, shares of RailTel have declined 10 percent, underperforming benchmark Nifty 50's 5 percent surge during the same period. title: Tech Mahindra shares in focus as it incorporates Saudi arm to expand footprint
content: Shares of Tech Mahindra will remain in focus on August 21 as the IT major announced the incorporation of its wholly-owned subsidiary, Tech Mahindra Regional Headquarters, in Saudi Arabia. The primary objective of this incorporation is to support, manage, and provide strategic direction to the company’s subsidiaries operating in Bahrain and Egypt. Earlier this month, Tech Mahindra disclosed that Pininfarina S.p.A., its step-down subsidiary, increased its stake in Italian stationery company Signature S.r.l. from 24 percent to 84 percent, thereby making it a subsidiary of Pininfarina and, in turn, a step-down subsidiary of Tech Mahindra. Catch all the market action on our LIVE blog The acquisition aims to strengthen Pininfarina’s footprint in the consumer channel and bolster the Pininfarina brand. The deal was conducted on an arm’s length basis and qualifies as a related-party transaction. The company clarified that no governmental or regulatory approvals were required for the acquisition. Signature continues to operate out of Italy. Pininfarina S.p.A. is headquartered in Italy and is renowned for its design and engineering expertise across sectors such as automotive design, industrial design, architecture, and luxury product development. For the first quarter, Tech Mahindra reported a 34 percent jump in net profit to Rs 1,141 crore, compared to the same period last year. Revenue grew 2.7 percent year-on-year to Rs 13,351.20 crore. The company also bagged new deals worth $809 million during the quarter, reflecting a 51 percent rise year-on-year. Tech Mahindra’s total headcount stood at 1,48,517, marking a net addition of 897 employees during the quarter. LTM attrition was reported at 12.6 percent. The company also highlighted that its cash and cash equivalents stood at Rs 8,072 crore as of the quarter-end. So far in 2025, shares of Tech Mahindra have declined by 10 percent, compared to a 5 percent gain in the benchmark Nifty 50 index. title: Can Sensex, Nifty carry their rally into a sixth day? Key levels to monitor on August 21
content: Nifty and Sensex are set to open slightly higher on Thursday, August 21, extending their winning run for a fifth straight session as early cues from the Gift Nifty signalled a positive start to trade. At 8 am, the Gift Nifty was trading at 25,110, higher by 0.12 percent or 30 points. Dalal Street extended its winning momentum for the fifth consecutive session in trade on Wednesday, August 20, as investors continued to remain optimistic around the Centre's plan to rationalise Goods and Services Tax (GST). Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates Foreign investors (FIIs/FPIs) offloaded Indian equities worth Rs 1,100 crore on Wednesday. At the same time, domestic institutional investors (DIIs) sustained their support with net purchases of Rs 1,806 crore, according to provisional exchange data. Here are the important levels to watch out for in today's session Nifty continues to exhibit resilience, led by strength in IT counters, while sustaining above the 25,000 mark has confirmed follow-through bullish momentum. Notably, major call writers have begun shifting their positions to higher strikes, adding further conviction to the bullish structure. A sustained push beyond 25,100 is likely to reignite strong upward momentum towards 25,250, forcing significant call writers into short-covering, thereby accelerating gains. On the flip side, support zones have shifted higher, with dips toward 24,800 expected to attract accumulation. Firm positioning by Put writers near at-the-money strikes lends additional support to this constructive view. Unless the index decisively breaches 24,770, the bulls are expected to retain the upper hand. For now, a “buy-on-dips” strategy remains the most prudent play, with traders eyeing a breakout above 25,200 to confirm the next leg of upside momentum. "Nifty Bank index is struggling to establish positive momentum as leading banking heavyweights are yet to deliver decisive strength, resulting in choppy moves. The immediate hurdle lies in the 55,800–56,000 zone, and only a breakout above this band could unleash strong bullish momentum, fueled by short-covering. On the downside, dips toward 55,500 continue to be seen as attractive accumulation zones, supported by firm put writing activity at near-the-money strikes," Dhupesh Dhameja of SAMCO Securities said. "A breach below 55,450, however, would signal early weakness and could push the index lower toward the 55,000 mark. Until then, sideways action is likely to prevail. In the current environment, a “range-trading” strategy remains the most prudent approach, with traders keeping a close watch on 56,000 for a potential upside breakout, and 55,450 as the level to watch for a downside breakdown that may resolve the ongoing consolidation, he added. India VIX remained largely unchanged, slipping marginally by 0.04 percent to close at 11.78. Despite persistent global uncertainties, volatility remains muted, suggesting an expectation of consolidation rather than sharp corrections. This subdued volatility underscores cautious optimism among market participants without signs of elevated fear. The Put-Call Ratio (PCR) has improved from 1.11 to 1.34, reflecting the strengthening dominance of put writers and the prevailing bullish sentiment. content: Indian benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty likely to open on a muted note today, tracking GIFT Nifty, which was hovering around 25,071 earlier this morning. title: Sebi close to finalising block deal norms, with higer price range and deal size
content: Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) is likely to finalise the framework for block deals soon, including tweaking the reference price range and increasing the minimum order size. Sebi had formed a working group which shared its recommendations recently. With inputs from market participants, Sebi is expected to finalise the framework soon. The block deal mechanism allows pre-negotiated deals between parties to be executed on the exchange within designated windows and under strict rules to prevent price manipulation. Moneycontrol had previously reported on May 27 that block deals could get a makeover, and on August 11 that the Sebi working group had proposed a broader price range and higher order size. The Higher Price Range for Block Deals As per sources, Sebi may come up with two kinds of price ranges for block deals. Stocks which are available for trading in the Futures & Options (F&O) segment may remain within the plus and minus 1 percent price range of the applicable reference price. Non-F&O segment stocks may be placed under the plus and minus 3 percent price range of the reference price. A working group formed on the issue had suggested a price range of 5 percent for the morning block deal window and a 3 percent price range for the afternoon trading window, though one of the exchanges had suggested a plus and minus 2 percent price range. NSE data for FY25 suggested that around 66 percent of block deals happened in non-F&O stocks. Higher Order Threshold Similarly, the minimum order size is likely to be revised to Rs 25 crore instead of the current Rs 10 crore. The working group had recommended that the limit should be hiked, and the rationale was that benchmark indices have increased nearly three times over the last 10 years. So, with the growth in the size and depth of markets, it is desirable that limits be increased. Higher Order Size based on Data Study Sebi also analysed the data of block deals of FY25 at NSE and concluded that 90 percent of block deals were of the size above Rs 14 crore, 75 percent above Rs 26 crore, 60 percent above Rs 50 crore, and 50 percent above Rs 84 crore. So, the need was felt to review the order size. Sebi had last tweaked the order size in October 2017. One market participant, on the condition of anonymity, said, “The higher threshold is expected to bring liquidity, as the orders below Rs 25 crore will take place in the normal market.” The Sebi working group was of the view that raising the order size limit would ensure participation mainly from serious institutional investors, not high-net-worth individuals or family offices, who bypass the main market via block deals. Also read: Sebi panel on Takeover Regulations reviews definition of control, no tweaks to open offer and creeping acquisition threshold Common Reference Price Duration for Block Deal Windows Sebi may also approve the common reference price duration of 30 minutes for block deal windows. The Sebi working group was of the view that it should be common across windows. Currently, the morning window’s reference price duration (8:45–9:00 am) is based on the volume-weighted average price (VWAP) of the last 30 minutes of trades from the previous day’s close. But the afternoon window’s reference price duration (2:05–2:20 pm) uses the VWAP of trades executed in the stock between 1:45 pm and 2:00 pm. OFS-like Mechanism as an Alternative to Block Deals It is also being discussed with stakeholders such as exchanges, clearing corporations, mutual funds, and brokers that a simplified version of the Offer for Sale (OFS)-like mechanism can be introduced for non-promoter shareholders. It will act as an alternative to the block deal mechanism. Though, it may take longer time to materialize. The mechanism of block deals was introduced by Sebi in 2005 and is primarily used by institutional investors such as mutual funds and insurance companies to execute large trades without disturbing the market price. An email seeking comments from Sebi on the proposed changes, did not elicit any response. Also read: Sebi mulls double-edged move: Higher intraday limits, with expiry-day clampdown and penalties for breach
summary_lexrank: A working group formed on the issue had suggested a price range of 5 percent for the morning block deal window and a 3 percent price range for the afternoon trading window, though one of the exchanges had suggested a plus and minus 2 percent price range.
summary_luhn: A working group formed on the issue had suggested a price range of 5 percent for the morning block deal window and a 3 percent price range for the afternoon trading window, though one of the exchanges had suggested a plus and minus 2 percent price range.
summary_lsa: Also read: Sebi panel on Takeover Regulations reviews definition of control, no tweaks to open offer and creeping acquisition threshold Common Reference Price Duration for Block Deal Windows Sebi may also approve the common reference price duration of 30 minutes for block deal windows.
summary_textrank: One market participant, on the condition of anonymity, said, “The higher threshold is expected to bring liquidity, as the orders below Rs 25 crore will take place in the normal market.” The Sebi working group was of the view that raising the order size limit would ensure participation mainly from serious institutional investors, not high-net-worth individuals or family offices, who bypass the main market via block deals.

title: Stocks to Watch Today: Clean Science, Shanti Gold, India Cements, RailTel, Jupiter Wagons, V-Guard, Fortis, Innova Captab, Poly Medicure in focus on 21 August

title: US-based Capital Group picks up 1.67% stake in Shaily Engineering Plastics worth Rs 148 crore
content: US-based investment management firm Capital Group, through two of its funds, acquired a 1.67 percent stake in Shaily Engineering Plastics — a manufacturer of injection-moulded precision plastic components — for nearly Rs 148 crore via an open market transaction on Wednesday. The Growth Fund of America, and American Funds Fundamental Investors, managed by Capital Group, have bought 5 lakh shares in Shaily Engineering at Rs 1,925 per share, and 2,68,179 shares at Rs 1,924.78 per share, respectively, which amounted to Rs 147.9 crore, the bulk deals on the exchanges showed. However, Lighthouse India Fund III, the private equity growth fund managed by Lighthouse Funds, sold 5 lakh shares in Shaily at Rs 1,925 per share, valued at Rs 96.25 crore. Shaily Engineering Plastics shares finished the session lower at Rs 1,912.8, down 0.78 percent on the NSE, following 6.4 percent rally in previous session. The action was also seen in HealthCare Global Enterprises, which shares climbed 2.14 percent to Rs 682.1 on the BSE, may be following nearly 1 percent stake buy by mutual fund house. Axis Mutual Fund acquired 13.92 lakh shares (equivalent to 0.998 percent stake) in healthcare provider HealthCare Global Enterprises at Rs 660 per share from promoter Basavalinga Sadasivaiah Ajaikumar for Rs 91.87 crore. Among other deals, Motilal Oswal Finvest, the part of Motilal Oswal Financial Services, sold 15,000 shares in Ahmedabad-based Pearl Green Clubs and Resorts (0.56 percent stake) at Rs 161.45 per share. As of June 2025, Motilal Oswal Finvest held 1.86 percent stake in Pearl Green Clubs. Sampann Utpadan India has seen a second open market transaction in the current week, falling half a percent to Rs 32.16. Isquare Global PE Fund bought 7,29,449 shares (1.8 percent stake) in Sampann at Rs 32.4 per share from Davos International Fund. With today's transaction, global investment fund Davos International Fund exited Sampann, the reclaim rubber maker. On Monday, Davos International Fund had sold 12.5 lakh shares (3.07 percent stake) in the company to Isquare Global PE Fund at Rs 32.96 per share. As of June 2025, Davos held 4.87 percent stake in Sampann. Meanwhile, there was block deal in voltage stabilizer maker V-Guard Industries shares that corrected 0.79 percent to Rs 370.45. ICICI Prudential Mutual Fund acquired 41,51,351 shares in the company at Rs 370 per share from promoter Chittilappilly Thomas Kochuouseph, valued at Rs 153.6 crore.
