title: HAL shares gain 3% as cabinet clears Rs 62,000 crore order for 97 Tejas Mk1A fighter jets
content: Shares of Hindustan Aeronautics Ltd (HAL) gained as much as 3.5 percent to Rs 4,605 in morning deals on Wednesday, August 20, after reports suggested that the state-run defence manufacturer is set to bag one of its largest ever orders. According to government sources cited by CNBC TV-18, the Cabinet Committee on Security has cleared the acquisition of 97 Light Combat Aircraft (LCA) Mark1A fighter jets for about Rs 62,000 crore. A formal announcement would mark a major milestone for HAL, which has been working on the indigenous Tejas programme to replace India’s ageing MiG-21 fleet. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates The LCA Mk1A, an upgraded variant of the Tejas, has been designed for enhanced combat capabilities. This will be the second big order for the aircraft after HAL secured a contract in February 2021. Deliveries are expected to kick off this year, with six jets scheduled for FY26, following the resolution of earlier engine supply challenges. UBS has maintained a ‘neutral’ stance on the stock with a target price of Rs 4,900, noting that execution of the new order will add to HAL’s already strong pipeline. Meanwhile, HAL posted a mixed performance in its June quarter results. Net profit declined 3.7 percent year-on-year to Rs 1,383.8 crore, even as revenue from operations climbed 10.8 percent to Rs 4,819 crore. A healthier product mix and execution of its Rs 1.89 lakh crore order book lifted operating performance — EBITDA rose nearly 30 percent to Rs 1,284 crore, with margins expanding to 26.7 percent from 22.8 percent a year earlier, defying expectations of a contraction. With a robust order pipeline, improving margins and a fresh round of aircraft orders in the offing, HAL remains firmly positioned at the centre of India’s defence manufacturing push. After Q1, Motilal Oswal said that the aircraft deliveries will likely pick up pace as engine supplies from GE ramp up, which should further support revenue visibility. At about 9:20 am, shares of the company were trading at Rs 4,560, higher by 2.5 percent from the last close on the NSE. Hindustan Aeronautics Limited shares are down 8 percent in the last three months. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: RVNL final dividend ex-date tomorrow; Rs 1.72 per share dividend due
content: Rail Vikas Nigam Ltd (RVNL) announced a final dividend of ₹1.72 per share, with the ex-date due tomorrow, August 21, 2025. Investors who hold shares of Rail Vikas Nigam until the end of today will be eligible to receive the dividend. Today is the last day to buy or sell the stock before it trades ex-dividend tomorrow onwards. RVNL stock's last traded price was Rs 327.75, reflecting a 1.22% increase compared to its previous closing price. This dividend announcement is a noteworthy event for shareholders, offering a tangible return on their investment. Rail Vikas Nigam's financial performance over the past year provides context for this dividend announcement. The company's revenue for the year ending March 2025 stood at ₹19,923.01 crore, while the net profit was ₹1,186.11 crore. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) for the same period was ₹6.15. These figures reflect the company's ability to generate profits and reward its shareholders. The market capitalization of Rail Vikas is ₹68,336.53 Crore A review of Rail Vikas Nigam's financial ratios further illustrates the company's performance. The Book Value Per Share (BVPS) for the year ending March 2025 was ₹45.90, and the Return on Equity (ROE) was 13.38%. The Debt to Equity ratio stood at 0.56, indicating a relatively healthy balance sheet. These ratios are important indicators of the company's financial health and its ability to generate returns for its shareholders.Dividend DetailsParticularsDetailsDividend per share₹1.72Ex-DateAugust 20, 2025From a financial year point of view, the company's performance can be examined based on key metrics. The revenue saw a decline from ₹21,889 crore in March 2024 to ₹19,923 crore in March 2025. Similarly, the net profit decreased from ₹1,574 crore to ₹1,186 crore. The EPS also experienced a reduction from ₹7.55 to ₹6.15. BVPS increased from ₹41.95 to ₹45.90, while ROE decreased from 18.00% to 13.38%. The Debt to Equity ratio reduced from 0.68 to 0.56. Analyzing the Income Statement, the company's sales dropped from ₹21,889 crore in March 2024 to ₹19,923 crore in March 2025. Other Income also decreased from ₹1,185 crore to ₹999 crore. Total Income decreased from ₹23,074 crore to ₹20,922 crore. Total Expenditure decreased from ₹20,452 crore to ₹18,828 crore, resulting in a decrease in EBIT from ₹2,622 crore to ₹2,094 crore. Interest payments reduced from ₹568 crore to ₹539 crore, and Tax decreased from ₹479 crore to ₹368 crore. Looking at the Balance Sheet, the Share Capital remained constant at ₹2,085 crore. Reserves & Surplus increased from ₹6,660 crore to ₹7,485 crore. Current Liabilities increased from ₹4,579 crore to ₹5,652 crore, and Other Liabilities decreased from ₹6,286 crore to ₹5,258 crore. Total Liabilities decreased from ₹19,611 crore to ₹20,481 crore. On the asset side, Fixed Assets increased from ₹460 crore to ₹1,027 crore, Current Assets increased from ₹9,745 crore to ₹11,667 crore, and Other Assets decreased from ₹9,405 crore to ₹7,787 crore. The Contingent Liabilities decreased significantly from ₹7,534 crore to ₹0. The announcement of a final dividend reflects Rail Vikas Nigam's commitment to delivering value to its shareholders despite recent fluctuations in key financial metrics.
summary_lexrank: The announcement of a final dividend reflects Rail Vikas Nigam's commitment to delivering value to its shareholders despite recent fluctuations in key financial metrics.
summary_luhn: On the asset side, Fixed Assets increased from ₹460 crore to ₹1,027 crore, Current Assets increased from ₹9,745 crore to ₹11,667 crore, and Other Assets decreased from ₹9,405 crore to ₹7,787 crore.
summary_lsa: Rail Vikas Nigam Ltd (RVNL) announced a final dividend of ₹1.72 per share, with the ex-date due tomorrow, August 21, 2025.
summary_textrank: On the asset side, Fixed Assets increased from ₹460 crore to ₹1,027 crore, Current Assets increased from ₹9,745 crore to ₹11,667 crore, and Other Assets decreased from ₹9,405 crore to ₹7,787 crore.

title: Thomas Cook Final Dividend Ex-Date Tomorrow; Rs 0.45 Per Share Dividend Due
content: Thomas Cook India has announced a final dividend of Rs 0.45 per share. The ex-date is due tomorrow, on 21 Aug 2025. This means that shareholders who hold the shares today will be eligible for the dividend payout; today is the last day to buy or sell the stock before it starts trading ex-dividend tomorrow. Thomas Cook stock's last traded price was Rs 166.57, reflecting a 2.14% increase compared to its previous close. Dividend Details The final dividend of Rs 0.45 per share represents a portion of the company’s earnings being distributed to its shareholders. The dividend payout is subject to shareholder approval at the upcoming Annual General Meeting. Financial Performance Overview Thomas Cook India has demonstrated substantial revenue growth over the past five years. Consolidated revenue increased from Rs 795 crore in 2021 to Rs 8,139.57 crore in 2025. Net profit has also seen a turnaround, shifting from a loss of Rs 295.18 crore in 2021 to a profit of Rs 254.61 crore in 2025. This financial recovery is reflected in the company’s Earnings Per Share (EPS), which improved from -Rs 6.83 in 2021 to Rs 5.46 in 2025. In the quarter ending June 2025, revenue stood at Rs 2,407.96 crore, up from Rs 2,105.94 crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same quarter was Rs 73.40 crore, slightly higher than the Rs 73.01 crore reported in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The EPS for June 2025 was Rs 1.55. Quarterly Financial Highlights (Consolidated)Quarterly Financial Performance (in ₹ crore)MetricJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025Revenue2,105.942,003.762,061.011,968.862,407.96Net Profit73.0171.6146.6663.3373.40EPS1.621.391.061.391.55Balance Sheet Overview The company’s balance sheet indicates a strong asset base. Total assets stood at Rs 7,115 crore as of March 2025, up from Rs 4,763 crore in March 2021. Equity and liabilities have also increased, reflecting the company’s growth. Reserves and surplus have grown from Rs 1,426 crore in 2021 to Rs 2,212 crore in 2025. Debt to equity ratio remains stable at 0.11 in 2025. Cash Flow Analysis Thomas Cook India’s cash flow from operating activities was Rs 717 crore in March 2025, compared to -Rs 581 crore in March 2021, showing improved operational efficiency. Net cash flow has also improved, reaching Rs 209 crore in March 2025. This indicates a positive trend in the company's liquidity and financial health. Overall, the dividend announcement, coupled with the company's positive financial trajectory, could attract investor attention. Shareholders should note the upcoming ex-date to determine their eligibility for the dividend payout.

title: Adani Ports shares rise 3.2% on Tuesday, among top gainers on Nifty 50
content: In Tuesday's trade, Adani Ports shares gained 3.18%, making it one of the top gainers on the Nifty 50. The stock closed at Rs 1,369.40 in yesterday's session. Financial Performance: Adani Ports' consolidated financial performance shows consistent growth over the past few years. The company's revenue and net profit have increased steadily. title: Hindalco shares fall 1.04% on Tuesday, among top losers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Hindalco ended lower in Tuesday's session. The stock was among the top losers on the Nifty 50. At yesterday's close, Hindalco stock was at Rs 706.70 on the NSE, a fall of 1.04% for the day. Financial Snapshot Hindalco has demonstrated substantial financial growth over the past few years. The consolidated annual revenue has increased consistently, reaching Rs 238,496 Crore for the year-ending March 2025, compared to Rs 215,962 Crore in March 2024. Net profit also saw a significant rise, from Rs 10,153 Crore in 2024 to Rs 15,999 Crore in 2025. The company's Earnings Per Share (EPS) improved from Rs 45.71 to Rs 72.05 over the same period. For the quarter-ending June 2025, Hindalco reported a consolidated revenue of Rs 64,232 Crore and a net profit of Rs 4,002 Crore, compared to a revenue of Rs 64,890 Crore and a net profit of Rs 5,284 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. For the year-ending March 2025, the net cash flow stood at a negative Rs 2,015 Crore. This is composed of Rs 24,410 Crore from operating activities, a negative Rs 24,739 Crore from investing activities, and a negative Rs 1,816 Crore from financing activities. Balance Sheet Hindalco’s balance sheet shows a strong financial position. As of March 2025, the company’s total assets were Rs 265,991 Crore, including fixed assets of Rs 117,270 Crore and current assets of Rs 101,959 Crore. Total liabilities amounted to Rs 265,991 Crore, with current liabilities at Rs 65,516 Crore. Key Financial Ratios Hindalco's financial ratios provide insights into its performance and stability. The Basic Earnings Per Share (EPS) was Rs 72.05 as of March 2025, compared to Rs 45.71 in March 2024. The Return on Networth / Equity was 12.93% in March 2025. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 5.00 per share (500%) on May 20, 2025, with an effective date of August 8, 2025. Other corporate actions include bonus issues in 1990 (3:5) and 1996 (1:2), and a stock split on August 30, 2005. The company has been actively communicating with investors. The transcript of the Q1FY26 earnings conference call for the quarter ended June 30, 2025, is available. Additionally, the audio recording of the earnings call is available on the company's website. Hindalco shares ended lower in Tuesday's session and was among the top losers on Nifty 50.
